title: Is it okay to aim for the JEE Mains than the Advanced? - Quora

response.answer_text: Aren't you going to put lot of efforts, time, and energy for scoring good in jee-mains? Well, if you are going to do so, then why not try for the best option. I would like to share a thought said by my teacher, Achhe Nit me un logo ka selection nahi hota jo nit ke liye prepare karte hai, jo log IIT ke liye seriously prepare karte hai magar unka nahi ho pata hai wo in NITs me jaate hai. TRANSLATION: Those people do not go to top NITs who prepare only for them, instead those who all seriously prepare for IIT-JEE but do not get selected there, go to some good NITs/IIITs. See, there may be at least 1,00,000 serious aspirants of IIT in India. Out of that 10k go to IIT, 3k in BITS, 1k each in Jadavpur University, Delhi Technical University, 1.5k in IIIT-Hyderabad, Delhi, Allahabad, Bhubaneshwar. The total of all these Tier-1 college's seats is 17.5k but let us consider this figure to be equal to 20k. Now what about other 80k aspirants? They too deserve admission in good colleges. So they opt for NITs, IIITs and CFTIs. Conclusion is: Virus said a true thing in 3 IDIOTS that, “ LIFE IS A RACE. Agar tum aage nahi badhoge to koi aur aage badh jaaega.” TRANSLATION: “ life is a race. If you will not run, then some other wiĺl go ahead of you.” His truth was being presented wrongly in that movie. And, You will realise this truth on the day of allotment of seats, when other aspirants with greater scores than you, will acquire those colleges, which you dreamt off to get in.

It completely depends on what you want. Here are some cases you might wanna consider: Case1- you want to get into iit no matter what… in this case obviously you'll be focusing more on advanced, probably not your case but I'm writing this because many people focus solely on jee adv and ignore jee main then end up with nothing…. So dont be “that guy”, pay attention towards the jee main type questions also… C ase 2 - you want iit but you'll do with other good colleges as well if you don't get iit… this is a very confusing scenario as far as most of us are concerned, the best tip is if you're okay without the “iit” tag, don't pay much focus to jee adv. Put 90% of your effort towards jee main and do your best to get into one of the top nit's or iiit's. I'll put emphasis on the fact that if you get any of the colleges I'm mentioning below, just blindly take it. Also, rather than aiming particularly for jee main Or advanced or any competition, just be clear with your concepts, because with strong concepts, you won't even need to worry about which exam you're gonna focus on… and do give jee advanced irrespective of whether or not you get a top college from jee main because it's a great experience and the preparation is really gonna make a better person out of you. Jee main colleges you should aim for : 1 iiith- probably the toughest to get into, but totally worth it, iiith is better than MANY IIT'S. Yes you read it right, it's better than most of the nit's and is at par with many IIT'S including iit roorkee and guwahati, if not better. 2. Iiita and iiitd: both are among the top iiits and although not up to the level of iiith, they are well in the competition. 3. Some top nit's: these include trichy, warangal, surathkal, rourkela and a couple more (you can google the list of top nit's) 4. Top colleges of your domicile state: I'm from delhi so in Delhi we have dtu, nsut and iiitd. Of you're not a delhiite, You can always google the top colleges in your state… Finally I'd write it again, please don't pursue a particular college, pursue knowledge. Keep your concepts clear and you'll rock your exams, be it main, advanced or any other. Good luck:)

I’ve Heard many say that AIM AT ONE THING AT A TIME. Then you can achieve great success in that. My Answer is YES.Look, I’ve seen several of my seniors who actually prepared for both MAINS & ADV. and they were not able to get very good ranks. MARK MY WORDS: Even if you get about 200+ in JEE Mains you can go into one of the top colleges(but not the IIT’s). Concentrate on Mains as of now. DO NOT Waste any of your time and start studying , if you haven’t yet started. YOU JUST HAVE ABOUT 6 MONTHS LEFT?(Max Possible Case). Even a Score b/w 150–200 is a good one. P.S: LETS MEET IN IIT

No, not at all!!!!!! If ur aim is getting a NIT or IIIT then it is not recommendable to focus only on mains because year by year mains difficultly level is increasing and some advance level questions are also there in mains paper , so focussing only on mains would not fetch u the result u want . I have seen many of my batchmates and seniors as well focussing only on JEE main and many of them ended screwing it up on the D-Day . There are certain topics which are in mains only . Everything which is in advance is also there in mains.

Yes , definitely it is ok to prepare for the jee mains instead of advance . Through mains u can get colleges of NIT OR IIIT or else. I don't know much about this as I belong to medical line but my relatives and my friends are there who prepare for this exam. I suggest you that dont think that only IIT is best college , through mains also u can get best college and achieve many good packages during job . Your future will be secure with it , and if you prepare for mains , u can crack advance also depend on your hardwork as well as luck.

I think no.!!!! If your aim is to get a good branch in top nits or iiits then you shouldn't aim only on the jee mains. Now a days the level of question in jee main is incresing basically. If you notice carefully you will find previous years jee advanced questions as it is in jee mains . You should follow jee advanced syllabus sincerely to solve tough problems of jee main. Choice is your's. Best of luck.

Absolutely okay . Don't let anyone make believe that you are aiming less if you are getting a rank within 20k in jee main you will get some good branches in some good colleges and that is all that matters not the tag of the college (though it matters but not a lot ) , believe me after your skills will decide where you will go and to which height I will reach and development a good skillset u need to be consistent in your college life that's it .

Aiming only for the JEE MAINS is not that bad. In some way or other you'll have to push yourself to the greater extent for the Advanced. Not that JEE MAINS preparation don't require that kind of preparation. If you know your worth and ability you can just prepare and get ready for JEE MAINS only.(being practical)Finally, at end of the day it totally depends on the students ability of cracking Mains/Advanced.

Yes, it is completely fine if you are aiming for JEE Main only but do keep in mind that by your JEE Main rank you can only get admission to the NITs, IIITs and GFTIs( Government Funded Technical Institutes) across the country. Every year many people aim only for these top ranked colleges across India and ace the JEE Main examination.

Of course, don’t run away behind the opinion of others . If you think that you can score good in JEE mains and not in JEE Advance then do it. If you score good you can IIIT Hyderabad, NSUT, IIIT Delhi, DTU,and some of some NITs which are way ahead of many IITs when it comes to ranking. And you’ll be surprised to know that average package of these colleges are far better than lower IITs. But at the end choice is yours. Choose wisely !

No , not at all… You have seen that this days mains are getting better and better.. its always advised to aim high.. please don't concentrate only on mains.. at last it will disappoint you and then you might regret.. so aim high sir… That's all and please focus on advance.. All The Best of LUCK BUDDY
Depends on you but if you really want to be an engineer then you should aim for advanced
